title: Manual journal entry without supporting documentation
description: Journal entries posted by accounting staff lacked proper supporting documentation including invoices and approval forms
managementResponse: Will implement mandatory attachment requirement for all journal entries over $5000

title: IT admin account shared between operators
description: Shared administrative credentials used by multiple IT staff to access production SAP environment
managementResponse: Will create individual named admin accounts and disable shared credentials

title: Late bank reconciliation completion
description: Monthly bank reconciliations consistently completed 15-20 days past the 10-business-day policy deadline
managementResponse: Additional staff will be assigned to reconciliation process to meet deadlines

title: Password policy non-compliance
description: System password settings do not meet corporate policy requiring 12 characters minimum and 90-day rotation
managementResponse: IT will update password policy configurations across all production systems

title: Server patching backlog
description: 47 servers have critical patches outstanding for more than 60 days exceeding the 30-day patching SLA
managementResponse: Emergency patching sprint approved and will be completed within 45 days

title: Vendor access not reviewed quarterly
description: Third-party vendor remote access accounts were not reviewed in Q2 or Q3 as required by policy
managementResponse: Will establish calendar reminders and assign vendor access review ownership to IT manager

title: Missing W-9 for new vendor
description: Three new vendors onboarded in Q4 2023 without collecting required W-9 tax documentation
managementResponse: AP team will perform retroactive W-9 collection and update onboarding checklist

title: Vendor payment terms changed without approval
description: Payment terms for two vendors changed from Net-45 to Net-15 without documented approval from Finance Director
managementResponse: Will require Finance Director sign-off on all payment term modifications going forward

title: Overtime calculation error
description: Payroll system calculated overtime at 1.25x instead of 1.5x for 3 pay periods due to configuration error
managementResponse: System configuration corrected and affected employees will receive retroactive payment adjustment

title: Late timesheet submissions
description: 22% of employees consistently submit timesheets after the Friday 5pm deadline causing payroll processing delays
managementResponse: Department managers will enforce timesheet submission deadlines through performance reviews

title: Project scope change not documented
description: Two construction project scope changes totaling $350K were implemented without formal change order documentation
managementResponse: Project management office will enforce mandatory change order process for all scope modifications

title: Change order approval delayed
description: Change order for structural reinforcement was approved 30 days after work commenced creating retroactive approval risk
managementResponse: Will implement pre-approval workflow in project management system before work can begin

title: Entertainment expenses exceed policy
description: Multiple executives submitted entertainment expenses exceeding the $500 per event policy limit without pre-approval
managementResponse: Finance will implement hard stop in expense system for amounts exceeding policy limits

title: Wire transfer approval gap
description: Wire transfers between $25K-$50K processed with single approval when dual approval is required per treasury policy
managementResponse: System configuration will be updated to enforce dual approval for all wires over $25K

title: Related party transactions not disclosed by George Sr.
description: George Bluth Sr. failed to disclose related party transactions with Sitwell Enterprises and offshore entities for the third consecutive year despite prior audit findings and management commitments

title: Ghost employee on payroll - Annyong Bluth
description: Individual named Annyong Bluth appears on active payroll with direct deposit to account matching another employees bank details. No valid employment records or tax forms on file.

title: Iraq construction project - no regulatory approval for overseas work
description: Bluth Company is performing construction work in Iraq without required US government export licenses or foreign construction permits. Project value exceeds $2M with no regulatory compliance documentation.

title: GOB authorized $500K for magic show venue disguised as project expense
description: GOB Bluth authorized $500K payment to Alliance of Magicians Convention Center coded as construction subcontractor expense. No legitimate construction purpose identified.

title: Same finding as prior year - bank recon delays
description: Bank reconciliation delays identified again in 2023 SOX review matching prior year finding af003. Management response from prior year was not effectively implemented.
managementResponse: Will hire additional temporary staff for reconciliation backlog

title: Cayman Islands account not disclosed to audit committee
description: Undisclosed bank account at Grand Cayman International Bank discovered during treasury review. Account not included in cash confirmation requests or audit committee reporting.
